ext_description.p:
A Part_tooling_feature is a type of . A Part_tooling_feature may be one of a
or a , or additionally may be a . A Part_tooling_feature identifies a feature for tooling purposes. A feature may be used for other purposes or may intrinsically be in a particular feature category, and in either of those cases the feature would be a Part_tooling_feature and also the other type of feature.
ext_description.note: Tooling purposes as used herein includes test instrumentation and measurement purposes, not just inspection, fabrication and assembly tooling.
ext_description.example: Examples of a Part_tooling_feature include, but are not limited, to slots, passages, notches defined by Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing methodology, as well as fiducials, and photo tool and mask alignment marks.

ext_description.p: A Test_point_part_feature is a type of . A Test_point_part_feature identifies a feature for use with test instrumentation.
ext_description.note:
A Test_point_part_feature may be related to a
if the layout view is also supplied.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: All instances of type Test_point_part_feature must also be of type .
A Fiducial_part_feature is a type of . A Fiducial_part_feature identifies a feature for product alignment with respect to a tool.

ext_description.p: A Tool_registration_mark is a type of that is used to visually indicate a reference alignment for tooling purposes. The geometric representation for a Tool_registration_mark is identical to the geometric representation of the that is part of the annotation for a pcb design.
ext_description.note: The difference between a and a Tool_registration_mark is that the is annotation and therefore is not to be operated on as part of the design geometric model wheras the Tool_registration_mark is a real feature of the tool model and is operated on as part of the tool geometric model.
In the case that tooling alignment registration marks are placed inside the outline of the pcb, Tool_registration_mark would be used instead of since the graphic directly affect the design shape.

note.p: Tool_registration_marks are included for manufacturing purposes, specifcally for ensuring accurate orientation and location of a set of photools in a fabrication facility.

ext_description.note: The Tool_registration_marks may be included in a design of a product category with an industry accepted name of "panel". This standard supports that usage by applications identifying a pcb as being an for a product in the 'panel' category. In this application the Tool_registration_mark would be included as part of the product geometric model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Part_interface_access_feature is a type of
that is identified to facilitate tolerance specification when an occurrence of the associated part is used in an assembly. Specifically, the intent is to provide identification that the function of the is to provide access via a void in the material to internal components or terminals which have been identified as having some function at the level. Part_terminals is an example of internal terminal in the material.
The reset button in a notebook computer requires a Part_interface_access_feature whose properties are coupled to the reset button to ensure correct functionality of the end product.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_interface_access_feature. There shall be one or more
for an connection_area. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The connection_area provides a means to geometrically specify an area for critical mechanical interface access properties. The area is void of material.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Part_interface_access_feature. The accessed_interface is the feature for which the Part_interface_access_feature provides access.
ext_description.note: The accessed_interface is at the same level of design hierarchy as the Part_interface_access_feature for consistency purposes. It is anticipated that will be populated as necessary to support the design process peculiar to the enterprise.

ext_description.p:
The inherited from shall be
for Part_interface_access_feature.
The accessed_interface shall not be this Part_interface_access_feature.
The Part_interface_access_feature shall not be a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Part_mating_feature is a type of
that is identified to facilitate tolerance specification when an occurrence of the associated part is mated to a complementary part. A Part_mating_feature is provided where there is no requirement to convey electrical functionality as would be provided by .
The use of multi-pin connectors may require specification of mechanical mating areas in addition to electrical terminals.
The plastic housing on some connectors may contain Part_mating_features.

ext_description.p:
specifies a role of the
for the Part_mating_feature. There shall be one or more connection_area for a Part_mating_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The connection_area provides a means to geometrically specify a surface area for critical mechanical mating properties.
ext_description.note:
The specified by the mating feature may be the same
that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole mating feature is the .

ext_description.p: The Part_mating_feature shall not be complex with .
The Part_mating_feature shall not be complex with .
The Part_mating_feature shall not be complex with .
The Part_mating_feature shall not be complex with .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Part_mounting_feature is a type of
that is identified to facilitate tolerance specification when an occurrence of the associated part is used in an assembly.
The use of high density surface mount parts may require specification of mechanical mounting areas in addition to electrical terminals.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Part_mounting_feature. There shall be one or more for a connection_area. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The connection_area provides a means to geometrically specify a surface area for critical mechanical mounting properties.
ext_description.note:
The specified by the mounting feature may be the same
that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole mounting feature is the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Thermal_feature is a type of that is specified as having a role in the exchange of heat with the application environment of the .
